title: European Investment Fund - role in the Tech Transfer market
segmentation: I would like to thank you very much, organizers for inviting European Investment Fund in this conference.
Before getting into my presentation, I would like to make a couple of comments.
From what the previous speakers said, including also the director.
Of Stephen Joseph incident, he said that TT is weak in Slovenia.
I think ask that we are having a European perspective is very weak throughout Europe.
And.
The major, let's say, issues that we have identified is that there is lack of focus marketing.
There is lack of visibility, there is lack of and there is lack of course of funding.
And this is something that we European Investment Fund, as a European Union organization.
We're trying as much as possible to.
Bing into this space, which is the technology transfer.
European Investment Fund is belong to European Investment Bank Group and it covers all European Union 27 countries including left a candidate countries and accessing countries.
We have an authorized capital of 3 billion euros and our shareholders is European Investment Bank, European Commission and several financial institutions in Europe.
And.
Very importantly, we are AAA rated.
Organazation what we are providing.
Our role is to provide risk financing for small and medium enterprise.
This is let's say the main line of business that we have.
But we also we are also providing specialized tools.
That they are covering the whole span over life of a company so.
I'm starting.

From the big transactions that we're doing, which is in portfolio guarantees and credit enhancement with banks throughout Europe we are investing in venture capital funds mentioning funds and mid market funds.
We are investing in venture capital and early stage funds.
And we're also expanding now in microcredit.
I.
The last thing that we do in the, let's say lower part of companies life cycle, is to put a lot of effort in technology transfer investing in business, Angels networks.
You know very well what is about technology transform.
Let's say I assume that I'm the less knowledgeable in this sector system, venture capitalists, although I'm an engineer I have dropped long time ago my engineering.
If knowledge is and I would like to go to the next slide.

To explain the what AF particular is doing in the technology transfer area in 2007, we have identified this need that the technology transfer sector in the European Union needs active support for everybody that had European Union policy objective.
So we established at that time a very small.
Team and we're.
We understood what is technology transfer an in the next five years.
This team.
Grow a lot.
And what we're doing now is that we are trying to fund technology transfer platforms primarily with universities and research institutes.
Where with our help, which is advised but most importantly funding those ideas that are coming from those technology transfer accelerators as we say.
You go a step forward and be closer to the market for potential commercialization.
We have done several transactions in this area.
We have partnered with Chalmers Innovation in Scandinavia we have partnered with.
Louvain University in Belgium, Belgium Louvain Waves University of Manchester, Karolinska Institute and very recently in the Baltics with Stratum a synonym premature.
And we have a symbol objective improve the commercialization of races.
Something that we achieved very recently is that we signed.
We brought together a lot of stakeholders, let's say, and people that they can help a lot as we believe in this area and we signed in Rome in June 2010.
The creation over working group between the European Investment Bank, European Investment Bank Fund case, the Depot of France Castle.
The deposit of.
Italy said it said that the I in Spain and also you know innovation Brown in Sweden, KF W in Germany and Vera ventures in Finland.
All those are financial investors.

The the objective of this partnership is mainly to support the emergence of European and national knowledge transfer infrastructure, so TTI offices, TTI funds and dissemination of knowledge accelerate the transfer of European research and technology to the market, which is our main objective.
Facilitate a well functioning knowledge transfer intellectual property economy.
Which means try to push research step forward towards the market and the industry step towards researchers and carries more open and transparent marketplaces for intellectual property.
You know very well that.
Let's say this area is very fragmented is not transparent, is not visible.
And exchange best practices and potentially to analyze investment opportunities jointly, which means all those institutions could have a major catalytic role.
It's in the funding of technology transfer.
Against idealism.
In the University of Move in with the CD 3 where we set up the Center for Drug Design and Discovery, which we also funded together with the University and its specialized in.
The discovery and development of new molecule drugs.
For the Pharmaceutical industry.
Let's say the main area of this platforms where we're working is this part here where this city for this technology transfer desk.
I say I would say is doing the screening the optimization and is pushing, let's say.
A more concrete idea torwards the pharmaceutical market.
Everybody is welcome to contact us in Luxembourg.
Communist agrees I didn't reduce myself.
I'm responsible for southeastern Europe based in Athens, but.
Everybody is welcome to contact us.
Learn more what we're doing because we also want to learn more from let's say, the people that they are doing the actual work with, mostly providing funding and.
Thank you very much for your time.
